definitions.definition: An act of being of assistance to someone.
definitions.example: I say I did him a service by ending our relationship – now he can freely pursue his career.

definitions.definition: The practice of providing such a service as economic activity.
definitions.example: Hair care is a service industry.

definitions.definition: A department in a company, an organization, a government department, etc.
A function that is provided by one program or machine for another.
definitions.example: This machine provides the name service for the LAN.

definitions.definition: The state of being subordinate to or employed by an individual or group
definitions.example: Lancelot was at the service of King Arthur.
I did three years in the service before coming here.

definitions.definition: A set of dishes or utensils.
definitions.example: She brought out the silver tea service.

definitions.definition: The act of initially starting, or serving, the ball in play in tennis, volleyball, and other games.
definitions.example: The player had four service faults in the set.

definitions.definition: The serving, or delivery, of a summons or writ.
(Israel, West Bank, also in Jordan, Lebanon and Syria) A taxi shared among unrelated passengers, each of whom pays part of the fare; often, it has a fixed route between cities.
A musical composition for use in churches.
Profession of respect; acknowledgment of duty owed.
The materials used for serving a rope, etc., such as spun yarn and small lines.

definitions.example: He is going to service the car.
He was going to service her.
